repository_info.description: RamaLama is an open-source developer tool that simplifies the local serving of AI models from any source and facilitates their use for inference in production, all through the familiar language of con

issues.title: MacOs M4 junk output with latest image on GPU
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I have a podman machine with libkrun support started and running using Podman Desktop. Its on the latest podman 5.5.1 as well.

```
2025-06-21 19:33:25 - DEBUG - exec_cmd: podman run --rm --label ai.ramalama.model=llama3.2 --label ai.ramalama.engine=podman --label ai.ramalama.runtime=llama.cpp --label ai.ramalama.port=8080 --label ai.ramalama.command=run --device /dev/dri -p 8080:8080 --security-opt=label=disable --cap-drop=all --security-opt=no-new-privileges --pull newer -d -i --label ai.ramalama --name ramalama_irmopnLcUa --env=HOME=/tmp --init --mount=type=bind,src=/Users/bmahabir/.local/share/ramalama/store/ollama/llama3.2/llama3.2/blobs/sha256-dde5aa3fc5ffc17176b5e8bdc82f587b24b2678c6c66101bf7da77af9f7ccdff,destination=/mnt/models/model.file,ro --mount=type=bind,src=/Users/bmahabir/.local/share/ramalama/store/ollama/llama3.2/llama3.2/snapshots/sha256-dde5aa3fc5ffc17176b5e8bdc82f587b24b2678c6c66101bf7da77af9f7ccdff/chat_template,destination=/mnt/models/chat_template.file,ro quay.io/ramalama/ramalama:0.9 /usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-serve-core llama-server --port 8080 --model /mnt/models/model.file --no-warmup --jinja --log-colors --alias llama3.2 --ctx-size 2048 --temp 0.8 --cache-reuse 256 -v -ngl 999 --threads 7 --host 0.0.0.0
7e392ef271db9a5dedfab8bd70804a4a204988e188a27409fad7b46b189d0e3a
🦭 > hi
HowHowHowHow how how
```

Using the cpu only container it works great, wondering what could've changed here?

### Steps to reproduce the issue

use podman desktop to create a vm with libkrun support 
then use ramalama

### Describe the results you received

```
🦭 > hi
HowHowHowHow how how
```

### Describe the results you expected

```
🦭 > hi
hi how are you
```

issues.author: bmahabirbu

comments.author: bmahabirbu
comments.body: I also tried with mistral which gave a bunch of ####. This reminds me of a issue I tackled a long time ago with cuda. It turned out to be a container build issue flag that was incorrect maybe its a similar issue

comments.author: bmahabirbu
comments.body:
think I caught the issue 

```
  vulkan | asahi)
    common_flags+=("-DGGML_VULKAN=1")
    ;;
```
It should be ON.

comments.author: bmahabirbu
comments.body:
actually lower down in build llama.cpp whisper script we see that it is indeed turned ON

```
ramalama)
    if [ "$uname_m" = "x86_64" ] || [ "$uname_m" = "aarch64" ]; then
      common_flags+=("-DGGML_VULKAN=ON")
```
So this couldnt be it

comments.author: bmahabirbu
comments.body:
somehow it magically fixed itself!

Maybe updating to podman 5.5 didnt fully take effect?

Might still keep this issue open if others were having problems

issues.title: llama server is not available at localhost when running "ramalama serve --host 127.0.0.1"
issues.body:
### Issue Description

To try to serve a model inside localhost only, I attempted to run `RAMALAMA_CONTAINER_ENGINE=docker ramalama serve --host 127.0.0.1 qwen2.5-coder:3b`. Trying to curl to `http://127.0.0.1:8080` failed, because ramalama instead of telling docker to do port forward from 127.0.0.1, it tells llama.cpp to serve at 127.0.0.1, which in turn makes docker port forwarding no longer work because it needs llama.cpp to always serve at 0.0.0.0 inside the container.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Step 1: Run `RAMALAMA_CONTAINER_ENGINE=docker ramalama serve --host 127.0.0.1 qwen2.5-coder:3b`
Step 2: 
```
curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/infill \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{
  "input_prefix": "import math\n\ndef calculate_factorial(n):\n    \"\"\"\n    Calculates the factorial of a non-negative integer.\n    \"\"\"\n    if not isinstance(n, int) or n < 0:\n        raise ValueError(\"Input must be a non-negative integer\")",
  "input_suffix": "\n    return result\n\n# Example Usage:\nprint(f\"The factorial of 5 is: {calculate_factorial(5)}\")\nprint(f\"The factorial of 0 is: {calculate_factorial(0)}\")"
}'
```

### Describe the results you received

Connection refused

### Describe the results you expected

can connect to http://localhost:8080 succesfully

### ramalama info output

issues.author: lephuongbg

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body:
Could you do a dry-run and look at the docker command we are executing, and tell us what you would have expected it to run?

The info looks like Podman info as well.

comments.author: lephuongbg
comments.body:
This is dry run command output:

```
RAMALAMA_CONTAINER_ENGINE=docker ramalama --dry-run serve --host 172.0.0.1 qwen2.5-coder:3b
docker run --rm --label ai.ramalama.model=qwen2.5-coder:3b --label ai.ramalama.engine=docker --label ai.ramalama.runtime=llama.cpp --label ai.ramalama.port=8080 --label ai

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: Interested in opening a PR? I think the thing to think about is there would be a differene on the llama-server in the --container versus --nocontainer use case.  Without a container the llama-server should be --host 127.0.0.1

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
Are you expecting docker does this or something else:

```
docker run --rm -it -p 127.0.0.1:8080:80 ...
```

?

I think the solution may be to introduce a --oci-port option, like we have a --oci-runtime option. That sets the -p option in docker. We have some options that kinda have a double meaning

issues.title: quay.io/ramalama/asahi:0.9 does not work
issues.body:
### Issue Description

latest asahi image does not work

### Steps to reproduce the issue

ask ramalama to serve a model

### Describe the results you received

ramalama exists with an error message

### Describe the results you expected

ramalama starts

### ramalama info output

```yaml
kraxel@dobby ~# ramalama --debug --image quay.io/ramalama/asahi:0.9 serve tinyllama

issues.author: kraxel

comments.author: taronaeo
comments.body:
This appears to be an ARM64 issue as denoted by the warning
```
WARNING: image platform (linux/amd64) does not match the expected platform (linux/arm64)
```

Tested on AMD64 and it is working fine. Let me test this on ARM64 and triage as well.

comments.author: taronaeo
comments.body: Okay sorry, I can't test this because I'm not on Asahi. Will leave this for other maintainers who run Asahi to test

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
Version 0.9 and 0.9.2 of these images only have amd64 variants which is wrong. We will be moving away from this asahi image soon and just use the ramalama one, when this gets rebased onto the mesa version in Fedrora rawhide:

slp/mesa-krunkit

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: Should be fixed now.

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: I must have screwed up on the upload.  Trying to repush images.

issues.title: Suspect code in Model.garbage_collection
issues.body:
### Issue Description

- `os.path.join(root, model_root, model_file)` is very unlikely to be correct, although I might be missing something here. If this leads to false misses, that can lead to unwanted file removals.
- `file_has_a_symlink` is clearly initialized in an incorrect place, leading to missed file deletions.
- (The O(N*M) file walk code does not scale ideally.)


### Steps to reproduce the issue

Found by code inspection.

### Describe the results you received

NotebookLM, when fed `is_symlink_to`+`garbage_collection`, finds these (+more) and does an OK job of expressing the details.

### Describe the results you expected

No thoughts, except Aha! moments, when reading the code

### ramalama info output

```yaml
N/A
```

### Upstream Latest Release

Yes

### Additional environment details

As of commit 3f012ba00ee31fdd76c5e3f07d1434ab8e386598 .

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: mtrmac

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: @engelmi PTAL

comments.author: engelmi
comments.body:
@mtrmac I assume these are the analyzed functions, right?
`is_symlink_to`: https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/main/ramalama/model.py#L154-L161
`garbage_collection`: https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/main/ramalama/model.py#L163-L181
Both are part of the old model store and aren't u

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
I'd love to see a demo of notebooklm, have never used :)

We can delete the old model store at this change, that ship has sailed

    ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 175, in main
    run_shell_loop(ramalama_shell)
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 159, in run_shell_loop
    ramalama_shell.cmdloop()
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.13/cmd.py", line 146, in cmdloop
    stop = self.onecmd(line)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.13/cmd.py", line 223, in onecmd
    return self.default(line)
           ~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^

                                     ~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 81, in req
    return res(response, color)
               ^^^^^^^^
UnboundLocalError: cannot access local variable 'response' where it is not associated with a value

$ ramalama run granite3-moe:3b
🦭 > What's the best beer glass shape to minimize heat transfer?
The best beer glass shape to minimize heat transfer is the pint glass, also known as the English pint glass. This glass shape has a narrower top and wider bottom, which allows for a more efficient heat transfer between the beer and the environment. The wider bottom of the glass helps to keep the beer cooler for a longer period of time.
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

See above.

### Describe the results you received

See above.

### Describe the results you expected

No crash or at least crashing every time.

issues.title: Only one model supported, got 4
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I'm trying to run the new granite 3.3 models from HF and trying to convert them to GUFF. I run `ramalama convert --gguf Q4_K_M hf://ibm-granite/granite-3.3-8b-instruct oci://quay.example.com/llms/granite-3.3-8b-instruct:20250618` but I end up with an error reading:

```
Download complete. Moving file to /tmp/tmpce67gg4m/model-00001-of-00004.safetensors█████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████▊| 4.97G/4.97G [02:21<00:00, 117MB/s]
Fetching 15 files: 100%|█████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 15/15 [02:21<00:00,  9.46s/it]
Failed to create new snapshot: Only one model supported, got 4: [<ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f8306386cf0>, <ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f8306341590>, <ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f8306341450>, <ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f83063308a0>]
Removing snapshot...
Error: Only one model supported, got 4: [<ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f8306386cf0>, <ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f8306341590>, <ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f8306341450>, <ramalama.huggingface.HuggingfaceCLIFile object at 0x7f83063308a0>]
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

run something like

```
ramalama convert --gguf Q4_K_M hf://ibm-granite/granite-3.3-8b-instruct oci://quay.example.com/llms/granite-3.3-8b-instruct:20250618
```

### Describe the results you received

Error and no converted model files

### Describe the results you expected

A model consisting of multiple files converted in a GGUF format

issues.title: Exception starting RamaLama after a fresh install on macOS
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I am trying to install and use RamaLama on my M1 Pro laptop with macOS 15.5 and using Python 3.13. I am using HomeBrew to manage the Python installations and to install RamaLama, but I have also seen this error when using `pip` to install. The installation works fine, but I get an exception when I try to run the RamaLama command.



### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Install ramalama using either `pip install ramalama` or `brew install ramalama`
2. Run the `ramalama` command

### Describe the results you received

`➜  /Users ramalama
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/homebrew/bin/ramalama", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ~~~~^^
  File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/ramalama/0.9.2/libexec/lib/python3.13/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 1182, in main
    parser, args = init_cli()
                   ~~~~~~~~^^

    configure_subcommands(parser)
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/ramalama/0.9.2/libexec/lib/python3.13/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 241, in configure_subcommands
    chat_parser(subparsers)

  File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/ramalama/0.9.2/libexec/lib/python3.13/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 919, in chat_parser
    parser.add_argument("--prefix", type=str, help="prefix for the user prompt", default=default_prefix())
                                                                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^
  File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/ramalama/0.9.2/libexec/lib/python3.13/site-packages/ramalama/chat.py", line 54, in default_prefix
    if os.path.basename(engine) == "podman":
       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^
  File "<frozen posixpath>", line 168, in basename
TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
`

### Describe the results you expected

I expected no errors to occur

### ramalama info output

issues.title: keeping shortnames up to date
issues.body:
### Feature request description

I am wondering what/how to keep the list of shortnames up-to-date.
It can be challenging due to the fast pace of AI model development.
What is Ramalama general policy here?

Some examples:

- latest Granite is 3.3 (vs 3.1)  [4.0 preview even exists now]
- Mistral 3.1 (`mistral-small-2503` exists)
- Qwen 3 exists (vs 2.5)
- latest Phi v4 (vs 2)

I guess there is a bit of a trade-off too - stability vs latest-greatest.


### Suggest potential solution

I wonder if it makes sense to focus more on `hf://ggml-org/` in general say?

Is there any way to provide more unversioned or `latest` aliases in general?

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

_No response_

issues.title: Fallback to Vulkan on unsupported AMD GPUs
issues.body:
### Feature request description

When using GPUs that are not supported by ROCm (i.e. RX 580/gfx803), Ramalama should use the Vulkan image automatically instead.

### Suggest potential solution

`amdkfd` driver exports `gfx_target_version` in `/sys/class/kfd/kfd/topology/nodes/*/properties` that can be used to detect the GPU architecture. Use it to disable the ROCm image for pre-`gfx900` GPUs.

### Have you considered any alternatives?

User can manually override the image in their configuration file, but I would prefer this working out of the box.

Alternatively, a custom ROCm build could be done to enable support for gfx8 GPUs, however the performance is ~20x slower than the Vulkan image in my own testing.

### Additional context

_No response_
issues.author: alaviss

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
This makes perfect sense to me, wanna open a PR @alaviss ?

Another secondary benefit of the is we can remove all the pre-gfx9 files from the container image. Haven't measured but it could save GBs in image size.

comments.author: Split7fire
comments.body: Also interested in working inference on not-so-old RX5700XT (gfx1010). Where can I find *Vulkan* image?

comments.author: alaviss
comments.body:
> wanna open a PR?

I can't promise that I will have time to work on this, unfortunately.

> Where can I find _Vulkan_ image?

The CPU image is actually the Vulkan image. Just add this into your `ramalama.conf`:

```
[ramalama.images]
HIP_VISIBLE_DEVICES = "quay.io/ramalama/ramalama"
```

comments.author: Split7fire
comments.body: @alaviss Strange, I tried to create config in `/etc` and in `~/.config` but seem nothing happened. I have ramalama 0.8.5. Can it be the issue?

comments.author: alaviss
comments.body: It shouldn't be, configuration support was added long ago. It's likely that you just placed the file at the wrong path. See [`ramalama.conf(5)`](https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/003612abf7ef6f6b9a0de0ebbccb5ae13c3f1f6d/docs/ramalama.conf.5.md) for where ramalama looks for configuration fi

issues.title: No user-directed error if model fails to load
issues.body:
### Issue Description

When using `ramalama run`, if the model fails to load (for example, because it exceeds the GPU memory size), no user-directed error is printed. Instead the prompt is displayed as usual. When actually trying to use it, a cryptic `Error: could not connect to: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions` error appears.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
ramalama run granite-code:34b
```
On a system that does not have enough GPU memory for this model.

### Describe the results you received

```
🦭 > test
Error: could not connect to: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions
```

### Describe the results you expected

Running the command with `--debug` prints the following information (before still showing the prompt):
```
ggml_backend_cuda_buffer_type_alloc_buffer: allocating 20199.32 MiB on device 0: cudaMalloc failed: out of memory
alloc_tensor_range: failed to allocate CUDA0 buffer of size 21180522496
llama_model_load: error loading model: unable to allocate CUDA0 buffer
llama_model_load_from_file_impl: failed to load model
common_init_from_params: failed to load model '/mnt/models/model.file'
srv    load_model: failed to load model, '/mnt/models/model.file'
srv    operator(): operator(): cleaning up before exit...
main: exiting due to model loading error
```

I would expect to see *some* kind of indication that the model failed to load even when not using the `--debug` flag.

npopov@fedora:~/repos$ ramalama --image quay.i

comments.author: taronaeo
comments.body: Actually I think Ollama throws a 500 status code in these scenarios right? But yes, this would definitely be a better user-experience improvement that we should make. Would you like to open a PR? 😃

issues.title: Invalid argument to --image silently ignored
issues.body:
### Issue Description

Passing an invalid argument to `--image` silently ignores the argument and falls back to the default, in my case `quay.io/ramalama/cuda:0.9`.

The case I actually ran into is of course not `--image foobar`, but rather `--image quay.io/ramalama/ramalama` trying to force execution on the CPU. This worked on ramalama 0.8, but on ramalama 0.9 it only works if the version is specified as `--image quay.io/ramalama/ramalama:0.9`, otherwise it just fails silently.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
ramalama --image foobar run granite:8b
```

### Describe the results you received

No error, fallback to `quay.io/ramalama/cuda:0.9`.

### Describe the results you expected

Error that the image is invalid.

More great work from @ochafik , we should look into the flag, maybe add it as an explicit option to RamaLama document it:

https://github.com/ggml-org/llama.cpp/pull/13771

It can be used to define the amount of reasoning you want, to the point one can completely turn off reasoning if they'd like.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
@rhatdan the alias we have:

deepseek -> deepseek-r1

is sometimes questionable.

deepseek-r1 is the reasoning one
deepseek-v3 is the non-reasoning one (it's MoE technically)

There's also more specific ones like:

deepseek-coder

I guess deepseek-v3 is the most generic one, but reasoning via deepse

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: Well shouldwe change deepseek -> deepseek-v3?

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
> Well shouldwe change deepseek -> deepseek-v3?

I actually think that's worse, because r1 is the "famous" one.

deepseek-r2 should be out soon.

issues.title: README example failing with `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ramalama'`

I tried running `ramalama run granite3-moe`, which is the example from the README, and I ran into this error:

```



### Steps to reproduce the issue

issues.title: Using ramalama server or run with --rag induces a core dump
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I'm attempting to experiment with ramalama and RAG (per https://developers.redhat.com/articles/2025/04/03/simplify-ai-data-integration-ramalama-and-rag) and am running into an issue. When I try to serve or run ramalama with rag (i.e. `$ ramalama run --rag quay.io/myrepository/ragdata MODEL`) it drops into a prompt ('>'), without the prompt prefix in both cases, and if you enter anything in the prompt you get a stack trace ending in an APIConnectionError followed by a core dump. If you leave the prompt up and try `curl localhost:8080` you'll get a connection reset, which is the same message in the aforementioned APIConnectionError. Seems like llama-server (or something else?) on the image is hanging, then crashing when it gets any kind of interaction. I even ran the command and when the prompt was available, attempted podman attach and that caused a core dump too.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Run the following (using real files, etc):

```
$ ramalama rag test.pdf quay.io/myrepository/ragdata
....
$ ramalama run --rag quay.io/myrepository/ragdata mistral:latest
```

2. Observe the process borking

### Describe the results you received

issues.title: quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag:0.8.5 is broken
issues.body:
### Issue Description

On Fedora 42, I have python3-ramalama.noarch 0.8.5-1.fc42.

Try:
```
$ echo "Something something about something." > out.md
$ ramalama rag out.md localhost/myrag:0.1

Building localhost/myrag:0.1 ...
adding vectordb ...
77cb9e6bb889865a049f6e595a5e6105a70febba556fad87ad45ca54f13a8a22
$ ramalama run --rag localhost/myrag:0.1 ollama://gemma3/gemma3:4b
> hello
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_transports/default.py", line 101, in map_httpcore_exceptions
    yield
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_transports/default.py", line 250, in handle_request
    resp = self._pool.handle_request(req)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_sync/connection_pool.py", line 256, in handle_request
    raise exc from None
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_sync/connection_pool.py", line 236, in handle_request
    response = connection.handle_request(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_sync/connection.py", line 101, in handle_request
    raise exc
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_sync/connection.py", line 78, in handle_request
    stream = self._connect(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_sync/connection.py", line 124, in _connect
    stream = self._network_backend.connect_tcp(**kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_backends/sync.py", line 215, in connect_tcp
    sock.setsockopt(socket.IPPROTO_TCP, socket.TCP_NODELAY, 1)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.9/contextlib.py", line 137, in __exit__
    self.gen.throw(typ, value, traceback)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpcore/_exceptions.py", line 14, in map_exceptions
    raise to_exc(exc) from exc
httpcore.ConnectError: [Errno 111] Connection refused

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openai/_base_client.py", line 969, in request
    response = self._client.send(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_client.py", line 914, in send
    response = self._send_handling_auth(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_client.py", line 942, in _send_handling_auth
    response = self._send_handling_redirects(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_client.py", line 979, in _send_handling_redirects
    response = self._send_single_request(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_client.py", line 1014, in _send_single_request
    response = transport.handle_request(request)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_transports/default.py", line 250, in handle_request
    resp = self._pool.handle_request(req)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.9/contextlib.py", line 137, in __exit__
    self.gen.throw(typ, value, traceback)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/httpx/_transports/default.py", line 118, in map_httpcore_exceptions
    raise mapped_exc(message) from exc
httpx.ConnectError: [Errno 111] Connection refused

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/rag_framework", line 217, in <module>
    args.func(args.vector_path)  # pass vector_path argument to the respective function
  File "/usr/bin/rag_framework", line 182, in run_rag
    rag.cmdloop()
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.9/cmd.py", line 138, in cmdloop
    stop = self.onecmd(line)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.9/cmd.py", line 216, in onecmd
    return self.default(line)
  File "/usr/bin/rag_framework", line 143, in default
    self.query(user_content)
  File "/usr/bin/rag_framework", line 105, in query
    response = self.llm.chat.completions.create(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openai/_utils/_utils.py", line 287, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openai/resources/chat/completions/completions.py", line 925, in create
    return self._post(
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openai/_base_client.py", line 1239, in post
    return cast(ResponseT, self.request(cast_to, opts, stream=stream, stream_cls=stream_cls))
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/openai/_base_client.py", line 1001, in request
    raise APIConnectionError(request=request) from err
openai.APIConnectionError: Connection error.
```

Also, the running container is quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag:0.8 and we see
```
bash-5.1# cat /tmp/llama-server.log
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-serve-core", line 17, in <module>
    main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-serve-core", line 9, in main
    from ramalama.common import exec_cmd
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ramalama'
```

This is because the ramalama modules are installed for python 3.11 (`/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama`), while `python3 --version` gives Python 3.9.21.

```
$ for v in 0.8.1 0.8.3 0.8.5 0.9.0 ; do \
    echo ">>> VERSION $v"; \
    podman run -ti "quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag:$v" \
      bash -c 'find / 2>/dev/null | grep ramalama/common.py; python3 --version; ls -lad /usr/bin/python3' ; \
    podman images | grep "/ramalama-rag.*$v" ; \
done
>>> VERSION 0.8.1
/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/ramalama/common.py
Python 3.11.9
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 19 Apr 28 11:40 /usr/bin/python3 -> /usr/bin/python3.11
quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag                                 0.8.1              d6d8d4f0ed25  6 weeks ago        3.97 GB
>>> VERSION 0.8.3
/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/common.py
Python 3.11.9
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 19 May 12 10:39 /usr/bin/python3 -> /usr/bin/python3.11
quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag                                 0.8.3              2cebb6ffbf75  4 weeks ago        4.13 GB
>>> VERSION 0.8.5
/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/common.py
Python 3.9.21
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 9 Feb 11 17:32 /usr/bin/python3 -> python3.9
quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag                                 0.8.5              4f18350f7dcc  3 weeks ago        3.9 GB
>>> VERSION 0.9.0
/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/common.py
Python 3.11.11
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 19 Jun  2 09:43 /usr/bin/python3 -> /usr/bin/python3.11
quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag                                 0.9.0              6ae625e673de  10 days ago        3.98 GB
```


Not sure what went wrong there. The code to build the rag container [here](https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/691c235b80ba7326436f8be426464e8504e6ca65/container-images/scripts/build_rag.sh#L32) seems confusing with respect to setting the python version, but not obviously wrong. From the build log [here](https://github.com/containers/ramalama/actions/runs/15275842608), I don't understand what went wrong.

There are no stable branches here for 0.8 version and the main branch is already at 0.9. But since any installed ramalama 0.8 version will try to use quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag:0.8, I think a fixed image should be pushed. It's might be simpler than to require every 0.8 user to upgrade.


---

`ramalama --image quay.io/ramalama/ramalama-rag:0.9.0 run --rag localhost/myrag:0.1 ollama://gemma3/gemma3:4b` does not work to select another image. Which is probably a bug:
```
        # force accel_image to use -rag version. Drop TAG if it exists
        # so that accel_image will add -rag to the image specification.
        if hasattr(args, "rag") and args.rag:
            args.image = args.image.split(":")[0]
        args.image = accel_image(CONFIG, args)
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

See above

### Describe the results you received

See above

### Describe the results you expected

See above

issues.title: Skip huggingface-cli fallback for llama-server style huggingface uris
issues.body:
### Issue Description

The huggingface-cli fallback logic will attempt to download the entire model repo for llama-server style huggingface references. There does not appear to be any logic in huggingface-cli to replicate the llama-server behaviour so would be best to just skip it

Should fail fast when pulling a llama-server style huggingface uri fails

issues.title: "ramalama lightspeed" command
issues.body:
### Feature request description

Connect our client to rhel lighspeed endpoint over TLS:

https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Arhel-lightspeed%2Fcommand-line-assistant+endpoint&type=code

just to achieve a basic chatbot, no complex functionality, just a basic chatbot that connects to the endpoint. Leave the enhanced features to:

https://github.com/rhel-lightspeed/command-line-assistant

Basically `ramalama lightspeed` should behave like `ramalama run` but it just connects to the lightspeed endpoint as a client.

issues.title: Explore replacing python3 ollama puller with "podman artifact pull"
issues.body:
We wrote an ollama puller from scratch in python3, it's like 2 http requests. But the final request is like a "podman artifact pull", explore if we can replace this pull with "podman artifact pull"

Potential benefits:

- pushing Ollama artifact to OCI registry without conversion steps
- we can take advantage of authentication code in podman and in general the great compatibility podman has with many types of OCI registries
issues.author: ericcurtin

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
Python3 implementation:

https://github.com/ericcurtin/lm-pull/blob/f688fb83fce2c96efeadb096b6cdaea11e133d4a/lm-pull.py#L262

the current ramalama implementation is based on this but more complex

issues.title: Performance regression between 0.7.4 and 0.9.0
issues.body:
### Issue Description

While working on an Podman AI Lab workflow to automate the update of ramalama version used in Podman AI Lab, I noticed, when switching from 0.7.4 to 0.9.0 a big performance drop in my validation tests:

Here are the logs from the server in the 2 configurations:

0.7.4:

prompt eval time =    3058.24 ms /    64 tokens (   47.78 ms per token,    20.93 tokens per second)
       eval time =   83033.60 ms /   455 tokens (  182.49 ms per token,     5.48 tokens per second)
      total time =   86091.84 ms /   519 tokens
	  
0.9.0:
prompt eval time =  121635.23 ms /    64 tokens ( 1900.55 ms per token,     0.53 tokens per second)
       eval time =   15152.22 ms /    93 tokens (  162.93 ms per token,     6.14 tokens per second)
      total time =  136787.44 ms /   157 tokens
srv  update_slots: all slots are idle


### Steps to reproduce the issue

Need Podman AI Lab dev and modifying the image reference in the code

### Describe the results you received

See above

### Describe the results you expected

Similar performance numbers

```yaml
N/A
```

Yes

issues.title: bug: ramalama convert TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable
issues.body:
### Issue Description

Ramalama fails to convert a HuggingFace model to OCI via the `ramalama --container convert hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf oci://quay.io/taronaeo/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF` command

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Following the example: https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/6d7cfa88a49f3b7e92a61ccba128c6ac10c7e7ab/docs/ramalama-convert.1.md?plain=1#L38-L58

3. Run the `ramalama convert` command: `ramalama --container convert hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf oci://quay.io/taronaeo/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF`

### Describe the results you received

```sh
$ ramalama --container convert hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf oci://quay.io/taronaeo/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF
Converting /var/lib/ramalama/store to /var/lib/ramalama/store ...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/ramalama", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 1155, in main

  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 662, in convert_cli

  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/oci.py", line 327, in convert
    self._convert(source_model, args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/oci.py", line 311, in _convert
    run_cmd([self.conman, "manifest", "rm", self.model], ignore_stderr=True, stdout=None)

  File "/usr/lib/python3.11/site-packages/ramalama/common.py", line 132, in quoted

### Issue Description

`nix run github:containers/ramalama` pulls in dependency `llama-cpp` which fails to build from source.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Using nixos, run `nix run github:containers/ramalama`

### Describe the results you received

[build failure log](https://pastebin.com/15SYUKk8).

### Describe the results you expected

The flake should work as documented [in the PR](https://github.com/containers/ramalama/pull/581).

N/A (does not build)
```

Yes

_No response_

_No response_
issues.author: waltmck

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: I have no idea how this is supposed to work.  Does nix attempt to build everything from scratch.  RamaLama is more about running AI MOdels in containers, so building llama.cpp for every platform is not one of our goals.

comments.author: smooge
comments.body: I believe the problem could be seen as being able to replicate building the containers that ramalama uses. That said, the bug would be better looked at llama-cpp versus ramalama to see why it is not able to build.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body: Yeah, llama.cpp should be it's own package... llama.cpp could be a dependancy of RamaLama, but it's not a strictly required dependancy as one can just use containers...

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: The issue is we build llama.cpp differently for each GPU.  So I don't believe it can be easily packaged.

comments.author: waltmck
comments.body: It is possible that this issue was caused by a `nixpkgs` update. issues.title: Unable to use --device to specify GPU device on a multi-GPU system (e.g.: /dev/dri/renderD129)
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I have a system with two GPUs, and I was previously able to run one model on each GPU, by having one of the terminals add a parameter that I was able to find via "ramalama --debug run":

```
$ ramalama run llama3.1 --device /dev/dri/renderD129
```

I forget what version of ramalama was on this system when this worked; amid some confusion of what caused models to stop running, I re-installed the system.  (As it turns out, with akmod-nvidia installed, I need to remember to re-run "sudo nvidia-ctk cdi generate --output=/etc/cdi/nvidia.yaml".)

The version that has the bug is python3-ramalama-0.8.2-1.fc42, which seems to be the latest available for Fedora 42 right now.  I have an older system that is running python3-ramalama-0.5.5-1.fc41, which I belive was updated near the time when I had the "run one LLM on each of the two cards" test running.


### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. In one shell, run `$ ramalama run llama3.1`.
2. Wait for the model to load.  Confirm (via nvtop) that "Device 0" has loaded the model into memory, and is using GPU time on "Device 0".  (If the model doesn't load on Device 0, try to find a way; perhaps using `--device /dev/dri/renderD128`.)
3. In another shell, run `$ ramalama run llama3.1 --device /dev/dri/renderD129`.
4. Wait for the model to load.  Confirm (via nvtop) that "Device 1" has loaded the model into memory, and is using GPU time on "Device 1".

(The GPUs on this system have 8 GB of memory, and the model seems to use 5.13 GB, so trying to load two models on one device would fail due to not having enough memory.)

### Describe the results you received

On the first execution of "ramalama run llama3.1 --device /dev/dri/renderD129", to try to have the model loaded on the render device for "card1", the model ends up loading and running on "renderD128", which corresponds to "card0".

While holding that first prompt open, trying to execute "ramalama run llama3.1 --device /dev/dri/renderD129" again results in a timeout after the first query:

```
Error: could not connect to: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions
```

At this point, nvtop shows the model loaded on "Device 0", using 5.133 GiB of 8 GiB (both cards are NVidia GeForce GTX 1070 Mobile GPUs), while "Device 1" shows 0.085 GiB / 8.000GiB" loaded.


### Describe the results you expected

What I expected, and was seeing before, was that I had two Ramalama sessions, one on each GPU, and it could be confirmed via watching nvtop for GPU usage and memory usage, while entering queries into each prompt.

Try these steps. I've just re-did the installation process and it should be the same for you since I'm on Fedora also.

1. Clone RamaLama Project
```sh
cd /opt
git clone https://github.com/containers/ramalama
```

2. Install RamaLama Python
```sh
cd /opt/ramalama
pip install argcomplete
source ~/.ba

issues.title: "Invalid reference format" error with ramalama-rag
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I have been able to get ramalama up and running by installing it with pip. I am trying to use ramalama-rag with the "--ocr" flag to "teach" models about a large pdf so that I can ask them questions about it. Something was definitely happening, because my CPU load increased for 30-45 minutes, but the program eventually returned with an error.

I thought it might have something to do with the way I specify the storage location of the generated OCI image. All the examples I can find in the ramalama documentation seem to involve storing the image on quay.io. Is there a way to store the generated image locally? Am I doing something else wrong?

### Steps to reproduce the issue

 I was able to reproduce it with a minimal example using a one-line markdown file.

The command:

ramalama rag ./minimal.md ./myrag_oci_image

The output:

Building ./myrag_oci_image ...
adding vectordb ...
Error: tag ./myrag_oci_image: invalid reference format
Error: Command '['podman', 'build', '--no-cache', '--network=none', '-q', '-t', './myrag_oci_image', '-f', '/home/USER/DIRECTORY/RamaLama_rag_st_103oa/vectordb/tmpsglj4o7o', '/home/USER/DIRECTORY/RamaLama_rag_st_103oa']' returned non-zero exit status 125.

### Describe the results you received

See description

### Describe the results you expected

I hoped the command would generate an OCI image containing rag data compatible with ramalama run/serve and store it in ./myrag_oci_image.

comments.author: bmahabirbu
comments.body:
@jnwatkins you'll want to specify it like this

`ramalama rag /path/to/minimal.md myrag_oci_image:latest`

That will tag the oci image as localhost/myrag_oci_image:latest 

You can check the output of `podman images`to confirm!

comments.author: jnwatkins

issues.title: Improve `container_build.sh` Help Information
issues.body:
### Feature request description

While running the `container_build.sh` or `container_build.sh --help` command, we see that only the `-d` and `-r` commands are listed in the help information. But looking through `parse_arguments()` in `container_build.sh`, there are more flags available than listed.

We should update the help information to include the additional flags, especially the `-C` flag that would have saved me a lot of time from rebuilding the container images.

FYI:
```
parse_arguments() {
  while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case "$1" in
      -h|--help)
        print_usage
        exit 0
        ;;
      -c)
        ci="true"
        shift
        ;;
      -C)
        nocache=""
        shift
        ;;
      -d)
        dryrun="$1"
        shift
        ;;
      -r)
        rm_after_build="true"
        nocache=""
        shift
        ;;
      -v)
        version="$2"
        shift
        shift
        ;;
      build|push|multi-arch)
        command="$1"
        shift
        ;;
      *)
        target="$1"
        shift
        ;;
    esac
  done
}
```

### Suggest potential solution

Include the missing flags into the help information

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issues.title: Ramalama sits idle for several minutes
issues.body:
### Issue Description

Running `ramalama --debug run deepseek-coder-v2:236b` will sit idle (0% cpu being used by the process) without any output for up to 40 minutes. Then it starts the model download, which can get stuck at 99% for another several minutes.

It might be something machine specific.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

`ramalama --debug run deepseek-coder-v2:236b`

### Describe the results you received

Very long waiting time for the actual download to happen.

### Describe the results you expected

The download to start right away.

issues.author: almusil

comments.author: almusil
comments.body: It happens when the `registry.ollama.ai` resolves to IPv6 on hosts that don't have IPv6 access, but have IPv6 default route. It would be nice to have a way of specifying the preferred address family e.g. `ramalama -4 run`/`ramalam -6 run`.

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: Interested in opening a PR?

comments.author: almusil
comments.body: Sure I can try to put something together.

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: I am now thinking this is not something we can or need to fix in RamaLama, since your system is badly configured.  We can not work around all of the issues that this bad network would cause, and users expectations of ramalama to only use IPV4 if configured will not work, since container engines and

comments.author: almusil
comments.body: That's fair point, there are ways how to avoid this issue on the host.

issues.title: Always failed to run a specific model using `ramalama run $model_name`
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I wanted to run a chatbot using the run command, but it never succeeded. Can you provide me with some tips on what happened here?



### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
$ cat /etc/redhat-release 
Fedora release 40 (Forty)

$ pip show ramalama
Name: ramalama
Version: 0.8.3
Summary: RamaLama is a command line tool for working with AI LLM models.
Home-page: https://github.com/containers/ramalama

$ ramalama pull granite3-moe

$ ramalama pull tiny

$ ramalama list
NAME                                      MODIFIED       SIZE     
ollama://granite3-moe/granite3-moe:latest 14 minutes ago 783.77 MB
ollama://tinyllama/tinyllama:latest       2 seconds ago  608.16 MB

$ ramalama run granite3-moe
🦭 > how are you?
Error: could not connect to: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions

$ ramalama run tinyllama
🦭 > what is the longest river in the world?
Error: could not connect to: http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/chat/completions

$ ramalama serve granite3-moe
serving on port 8080
build: 5335 (d8919424) with cc (GCC) 11.5.0 20240719 (Red Hat 11.5.0-5) for x86_64-redhat-linux
system info: n_threads = 4, n_threads_batch = 4, total_threads = 8

```

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0a6a322-71c1-4199-bf83-465537b00e24)



### Describe the results you received

the `ramalama run` always failed, but it's successful to serve the model using `ramalama serve`.

### Describe the results you expected

I expected that I could run the chatbot successfully.

issues.title: bug(ramalama-run): AttributeError: 'RamaLamaShell' object has no attribute 'do_hello'. Did you mean: 'do_help'?
issues.body:
### Issue Description

While running the command `podman exec -it ramalama ramalama run hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf`, chatting with the model with a message of "hello world" causes it to return `None` and crash entirely.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. `podman run -td --name ramalama ramalama`
2. `podman exec -it ramalama ramalama run hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf`
3. Type in `hello world` and notice that it crashes with `None` and throws `AttributeError: 'RamaLamaShell' object has no attribute 'do_hello'. Did you mean: 'do_help'?`

### Describe the results you received

```
podman exec -it ramalama ramalama run hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf
Downloading hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf:latest ...
Trying to pull hf://lmstudio-community/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-GGUF/Qwen2.5-1.5B-Instruct-Q4_K_M.gguf:latest ...
 99% |████  |  933.18 MB/ 940.37 MB 110.93 MB/s        0s
🦙 > hello world
NoneTraceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/cmd.py", line 214, in onecmd
    func = getattr(self, 'do_' + cmd)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'RamaLamaShell' object has no attribute 'do_hello'. Did you mean: 'do_help'?

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 193, in <module>
    main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 188, in main
    run_shell_loop(ramalama_shell)
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 170, in run_shell_loop
    ramalama_shell.cmdloop()
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/cmd.py", line 138, in cmdloop
    stop = self.onecmd(line)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.11/cmd.py", line 216, in onecmd
    return self.default(line)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 114, in default
    response = req(self.conversation_history, self.url, self.parsed_args)
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 83, in req
    return res(response, parsed_args.color)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-client-core", line 49, in res
    assistant_response += choice
TypeError: can only concatenate str (not "NoneType") to str
```

### Describe the results you expected

The model should respond appropriately without crashing.

### ramalama info output

```yaml

issues.title: Quadlet generator output misses mmproj mount
issues.body:
### Issue Description

The quadlet generator (ran for granite3.2-vision)  output seems to miss the mount for `mmproj.file`. 



### Steps to reproduce the issue

When running ramalama serve with `hf://ibm-research/granite-vision-3.2-2b-GGUF`, two mounts are created in the quadlet, one with the familiar `/mnt/models/model.file` and one for `/mnt/models/mmproj.file`. That second one (that mounts `mmproj-model-f16.guff` to `/mnt/models/mmproj.file` in the container) is missing.

1. generate a quadlet like `ramalama serve -p 8888 -c 0 --generate quadlet hf://ibm-research/granite-vision-3.2-2b-GGUF`
2. run the quadlet
3. watch output 
4. see it break :) 

### Describe the results you received

file not found error at the end of startup

### Describe the results you expected

model running

issues.author: yeahdongcn

comments.body:
Yes open a PR with a new Containerfile in here for the new protocol, build it, test it:

https://github.com/containers/ramalama/tree/main/container-images

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body: You also want to figure out a way of auto-detecting a device is of type Moore Threads, so this image is automatically pulled

comments.author: ericcurtin

Also you'll notice we poke some holes as required for GPU's in this function:

https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/4f240699da40e0e2da4fca94dd40501349106ef9/ramalama/engine.py#L117

I dunno if there's any extra ones required for Moore Threads... But if there is, that's the place to put it

issues.title: Multimodal/vision for "ramlama serve"
issues.body:
### Feature request description

When running like so, we should detect there is a mmproj-* .gguf file, download two files and serve in a multimodal/vision way:

`ramlama serve hf://ggml-org/SmolVLM-500M-Instruct-GGUF`

Here is how to do it with just llama.cpp and two files:

```
#!/bin/bash

model_file="/Users/ecurtin/.local/share/ramalama/store/huggingface/ggml-org/SmolVLM-500M-Instruct-GGUF/SmolVLM-500M-Instruct-Q8_0.gguf/blobs/sha256-9d4612de6a42214499e301494a3ecc2be0abdd9de44e663bda63f1152fad1bf4"
mmproj_file="/Users/ecurtin/.local/share/ramalama/store/huggingface/ggml-org/SmolVLM-500M-Instruct-GGUF/mmproj-SmolVLM-500M-Instruct-Q8_0.gguf/blobs/sha256-d1eb8b6b23979205fdf63703ed10f788131a3f812c7b1f72e0119d5d81295150"

llama-server --model "$model_file" --mmproj "$mmproj_file"
```

Easy way to test is use index.html from here:

https://github.com/ngxson/smolvlm-realtime-webcam

### Suggest potential solution

_No response_

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issues.title: make build fails with Docker due to --volume flag
issues.body:
### Issue Description

It looks like the following commit introduced a --volume flag that breaks Docker-based builds:
https://github.com/containers/ramalama/commit/6c59fd7fd50ffe0048f1558f2062f0bbe76f706e

As a result, `make build` no longer works correctly in Docker environments.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

`make build` with Docker installed

### Describe the results you received

docker build --no-cache --platform linux/x86_64 --volume=/home/xiaodongye/ws/ggml/ramalama:/run/ramalama --security-opt=label=disable -t quay.io/ramalama/ramalama -f ramalama/Containerfile .
unknown flag: --volume
See 'docker buildx build --help'.
make: *** [Makefile:104: build] Error 125

### Describe the results you expected

`make build` pass

### ramalama info output

```yaml
N/A
```

### Upstream Latest Release

Yes

### Additional environment details

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: yeahdongcn

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body:
I guess the question is whether or not you want RamaLama installed within the container, if not, we could just build on docker and ignore an empty /run/ramalama

Another option would be to checkout the ramalama project and install the main branch. The current tool installs whatever is checkout in yo

ramalama --image quay.io/ramalama/cuda:0.8.3  serve deepseek-r1:7b

issues.title: Vision models
issues.body:
## Value Statement

As someone who wants a boring way to use AI
I would like to expose an image/PDF/document to the LLM
So that I can make requests and extract information, all within Ramalama

## Notes

Various models now contain vision functionality, where they can ingest data from images, and answer questions about those images.  Recently, the accuracy of these LLM-based OCR text extractions can exceed that of dedicated OCR tooling (even paid products like AWS Textract).  The same vision models can also be used to extract information from PDF documents fairly easily after converting them to images.

We can use a similar interface to the planned Whisper.cpp implementation, since both are just contexts or data we provide to the LLMs.  This has not been detailed anywhere, so below is a proposal/example of how it could look.

```
$ ramalama run --context-file ./document.pdf phi3.5-vision
>> When is this letter dated?
The date in the letter is `1st January 1999`

>> What is this document about?
This document is an instruction manual detailing how to use Ramalama, a cool new way to run LLMs (Large Language Models) across Linux and MacOS.  It supports text and vision-based models.

$ ramalama run --context-file ./painting.png phi3.5-vision
>> What is in the painting?
This is an abstract oil painting about something and something else.  It seems to be inspired by some artist.
```

The primary issue is neither ollama or llama.cpp support vision models at this moment, so would either need a custom implementation, or would require adding something like vllm.
issues.author: p5

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
We had intended on merging vllm support soon, we started it here:

https://github.com/containers/ramalama/pull/97

this is what we think an outline of what it should look like, basically we want to introduce a --runtime flag, kinda like like  the podman one that switches between crun, runc, krun

issues.title: Provide model info in chat ui & allow multiple models
issues.body:
Rather than serving all models with generic `model.file` filename, ramalama should provide more information about the currently served or loaded models.

Also, could allow passing a model-config file to allow to switch easily between models with a single instance of a server. 
https://llama-cpp-python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/server/#configuration-and-multi-model-support 

Here, I've renamed the file ramalama downloaded to `granite-code` so it shows at llamacpp:port/models.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25ac6fed-f7e7-4fb7-9890-bca1210b25b1)

Currently, any model served by ramalama is listed as `model.file` 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/71c7316b-34d7-4233-9510-56ddd0175a9a)
issues.author: sallyom

issues.title: ramalama unecessarily expects /usr/bin/nvidia-container-runtime on Fedora 42
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I setup ramalama on Fedora 42 according to the instructions. `podman run --rm --device=nvidia.com/gpu=all fedora nvidia-smi` shows the nvidia device.

`ramalama run granite` fails with: `Error: no valid executable found for OCI runtime /usr/bin/nvidia-container-runtime: invalid argument`

I am using golang-github-nvidia-container-toolkit-1.17.3-1.fc42 and python3-ramalama-0.7.2-1.fc42. The file`/usr/bin/nvidia-container-runtime` does not exist on my system with these packages installed.

I noticed that removing https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/main/ramalama/model.py#L322 makes ramalama work as expected.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Steps to reproduce the issue
1. dnf install  nvidia-container-toolkit python3-ramalama
2. nvidia-ctk cdi generate --output=/etc/cdi/nvidia.yaml
3. nvidia-ctk config --in-place --set nvidia-container-runtime.mode=cdi # not sure if this is needed
4. ramalama run granite



### Describe the results you received

Error: no valid executable found for OCI runtime /usr/bin/nvidia-container-runtime: invalid argument

### Describe the results you expected

ramalama prompt

issues.title: Add support for vision model
issues.body:
### Feature request description

llama.cpp now supports vision model, see: https://simonwillison.net/2025/May/10/llama-cpp-vision/ and https://github.com/ggml-org/llama.cpp/blob/master/docs/multimodal.md .

Here is an example usage with the rpc-server built with the latest upstream:

```ShellSession
$ ./build/bin/rpc-server -c -p 8080 &
$ ./build/bin/llama-mtmd-cli -hf unsloth/gemma-3-4b-it-GGUF:Q4_K_XL --rpc 127.0.0.1:8080
...
> /image /usr/share/icons/Adwaita/16x16/devices/audio-headphones.png
Image /usr/share/icons/Adwaita/16x16/devices/audio-headphones.png loaded

> Describe the image
...
``` 

### Suggest potential solution

- [x] Update the llama.cpp version in `container-images/scripts/build_llama_and_whisper.sh`
- [ ] Adjust the client to use the mtmd for handling multimodal inputs.

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
issues.author: TristanCacqueray

issues.title: Ramalama run fails with OLMoE model
issues.body:
### Issue Description

OLMoE (https://github.com/allenai/OLMoE) is an open model with all data, code and logs. When trying to run it with ramalama, there is only repeating metadata visible in the chat.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
ramalama  run  hf://allenai/OLMoE-1B-7B-0924-GGUF/olmoe-1b-7b-0924-q4_k_m.gguf

🦭 > what is olmoe?
```

### Describe the results you received

endless output of:
```
what is assisant?<|im_end|>
<|im_start|>assitant
what is aidtant?<|im_end|>
<|im_start|>assistant
what is assistat?<|im_end|>
<|im_start|>assistat
what is asissta?<|im_end|>
<|im_start|>assistance
what is aidtance?<|im_end|>
<|im_start|>assistance
what is aidsta?<|im_end|>
<|im_start|>assistat
what is asista?<|im^C
🦭 > 

```

### Describe the results you expected

A proper response from the model.

issues.title: llama-server doesn't start with ramalama serve --rag: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ramalama'
issues.body:
### Issue Description

llama-server doesn't start with ramalama serve --rag

`/tmp/llama-server.log` shows 

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-serve-core", line 17, in <module>
    main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/libexec/ramalama/ramalama-serve-core", line 9, in main
    from ramalama.common import exec_cmd
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ramalama'
```

Checking the container it looks like python3 points to python3.11 while the ramalama module was installed for python3.9:

issues.author: mcornea

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body:
This is happening because of a mixup between python versions.  We need to move away from ubi9 and get to ubi10 or move to fedora:42.

Sadly llama.cpp can not be built with fedora 42 gcc compiler at this time.

issues.title: On a system with dual 3090 Nvidia GPUs a single GPU is used when running ramalama serve and fails with cudaMalloc failed: out of memory as the model is too large for a single GPU
issues.body:
### Issue Description

On a system with dual 3090 Nvidia GPUs a single GPU is used when running ramalama serve and fails with cudaMalloc failed: out of memory as the model is too large for a single GPU.

```
nvidia-smi
Tue May  6 22:09:48 2025       
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 570.133.20             Driver Version: 570.133.20     CUDA Version: 12.8     |
|-----------------------------------------+------------------------+----------------------+

| Fan  Temp   Perf          Pwr:Usage/Cap |           Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|                                         |                        |               MIG M. |
|=========================================+========================+======================|
|   0  NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090        Off |   00000000:06:00.0 Off |                  N/A |
| 37%   27C    P8              9W /  275W |       4MiB /  24576MiB |      0%      Default |
|                                         |                        |                  N/A |
+-----------------------------------------+------------------------+----------------------+
|   1  NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090        Off |   00000000:21:00.0 Off |                  N/A |
| 38%   26C    P8              7W /  275W |       4MiB /  24576MiB |      0%      Default |
|                                         |                        |                  N/A |
+-----------------------------------------+------------------------+----------------------+
                                                                                         
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                                              |
|  GPU   GI   CI              PID   Type   Process name                        GPU Memory |
|        ID   ID                                                               Usage      |
|=========================================================================================|
|  No running processes found                                                             |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

`ramalama serve deepseek-r1:70b`

### Describe the results you received

issues.author: mcornea

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body:
llama.cpp does not support multiple GPUs (I believe).  You might need to use vllm for something like this, which is not well supported in RamaLama.
@ggerganov Am I correct?

comments.author: mcornea
comments.body:
It does seem to run fine when updating `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0,1` in https://github.com/containers/ramalama/blob/main/ramalama/common.py#L394

```
ramalama --debug  serve deepseek-r1:70b 
Checking if 8080 is available
serving on port 8080
exec_cmd:  podman run --rm --label ai.ramalama.model=deepseek

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: Do you think we should change to that as default, when using llama.cpp?  Would that work on systems with only one GPU.

comments.author: mcornea
comments.body: I started https://github.com/containers/ramalama/pull/1355 which should address the issue by passing all available GPUs in the `CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES` env var which should work for both single and multi GPUs.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body: Can llama.cpp utilize multiple GPUs? If no, we should use the most appropriate one

issues.title: Ai will crash if reached context size
issues.body:
After playing with the AI for a while it will crash after exceeding the context size. Should we increase the context size so this doesn't happen to the end user?  

```
context size exceeded
llama_decode: failed to decode, ret = 1
failed to decode
failed to generate response
brian@DESKTOP-SB69448:~/ramalama$
```
issues.author: bmahabirbu

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body: This is something that needs to be resolved in llama.cpp rather than RamaLama

comments.author: dylanmtaylor
comments.body: I'm also hitting this issue a bunch

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body: You can manually change it via "-c", but any kind of automatic change of context size changing would have to go to llama.cpp

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body:
Is this getting any better with the latest release?

One key issue is when AI go into infinite loops. I would prefer them to crash rather then burn energy.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
This might go away when we move to the client server approach:

https://github.com/containers/ramalama/pull/1068

issues.title: `ramalama` model store has issues reconciling between system and virtualenv installations
issues.body:
### Issue Description

I have a Fedora system with the `python3-ramalama` package installed via `dnf`

When I also try to install `ramalama` via `pip` in a virtualenv, I get some strange behavior with the model store

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Install `python3-ramalama` via `dnf` on a Fedora system
2. Download a model
3. Create a virtualenv and install `ramalama` via `pip`

### Describe the results you received

```bash
instructlab@beanlab1:~$ ramalama ls
NAME                     MODIFIED       SIZE   
ollama://llama3.2:latest 20 seconds ago 1.88 GB
instructlab@beanlab1:~$ python -m venv venv
instructlab@beanlab1:~$ source venv/bin/activate
(venv) instructlab@beanlab1:~$ pip install --quiet ramalama
(venv) instructlab@beanlab1:~$ ramalama ls
Starting importing AI models to new store...
Failed to import /home/instructlab/.local/share/ramalama/models/ollama: No such file: '/home/instructlab/.local/share/ramalama/models/ollama/llama3.2'
NAME                              MODIFIED     SIZE
ollama://llama3.2/llama3.2:latest 55 years ago 0 B 
(venv) instructlab@beanlab1:~$ deactivate 
instructlab@beanlab1:~$ ramalama ls
NAME MODIFIED SIZE
instructlab@beanlab1:~$ 
```

### Describe the results you expected

Model store should be the same, regardless of where RamaLama is being run

issues.title: Fix CI tests so they run with the currently checked in version of the container
issues.body:
### Feature request description

Currently when our test suite runs, it uses the last released version of the container, this can slow down development and cause maintenance issues. We build the CPU inferencing version of the container image in each CI build, make sure we use that one.

### Suggest potential solution

_No response_

Trying to run a local rag with ramalama v0.8.0 using tinyllama model, it says:

Error: statfs /home/douglas/.local/share/ramalama/store/ollama/tinyllama/tinyllama/snapshots/sha256-82cad9d8c383d729a0e9eeedcabc51316fdb40c9961d75673007439a4d3fc81e/chat_template_converted: no such file or directory

cat /etc/redhat-release
Fedora release 41 (Forty One)

### Steps to reproduce the issue

ramalama rag ./README.md localhost/dougsland_readme

Error: statfs /home/douglas/.local/share/ramalama/store/ollama/tinyllama/tinyllama/snapshots/sha256-82cad9d8c383d729a0e9eeedcabc51316fdb40c9961d75673007439a4d3fc81e/chat_template_converted: no such file or directory

issues.title: Support goose integration
issues.body:
goose has support for ollama. 
https://block.github.io/goose/docs/getting-started/providers#local-llms-ollama

It will be nice to have it work with ramalama as well.

I tried configuring ramalama through the ollama integration and see this:

Started model serving
```
ramalama serve --name mygranite granite3-moe:latest
serving on port 8080

```

Tried to configure goose
```
 goose configure

This will update your existing config file
  if you prefer, you can edit it directly at /home/mrunalp/.config/goose/config.yaml

┌   goose-configure 
│
◇  What would you like to configure?
│  Configure Providers 
│
◇  Which model provider should we use?
│  Ollama 
│
●  OLLAMA_HOST is already configured
│  
◇  Would you like to update this value?
│  Yes 
│
◇  Enter new value for OLLAMA_HOST
│  http://0.0.0.0:8080
│
◇  Enter a model from that provider:
│  granite3-moe:latest
│
◇  Server error: Object {"error": Object {"code": Number(500), "message": String("tools param requires --jinja flag"), "type": String("server_error")}}
│
└  Failed to configure provider: init chat completion request with tool did not succeed.

```

ramalama serve --name mygranite --runtime-args="--jinja" granite3-moe:latest

issues.title: interactive mode CLI
issues.body:
### Feature request description

each time I run commands, I enter `ramalama <something>` like `ramalama run <something>`

I would like to know if an interactive mode would be possible where I could enter in an interactive `chat` and then only enter the RamaLama arguments where I would have completion, etc.

like

```
ramalama --interactive

info
 ....

run foo
  ....
^C
version

convert tinyllama foo
```


### Suggest potential solution

_No response_

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
issues.author: benoitf

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: Why do you want this?

comments.author: benoitf
comments.body:
I launch once the cli container and then all commands are ramalama commands. I don't need to prefix all my commands or to run again a new container 

Like I run the python or node.js container

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: That feels like something you could build simply for yourself.  Not sure there would be huge demand for this.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
alias rl="ramalama"

springs to mind.

This isn't incredibly hard to implement as a separate project. This is basically implement my own custom shell.

The thing is when you execute run, then we have to spin up another shell of sorts so we would have to maintain multiple shells.

issues.title: partial alias/mapping between a container and the model being used
issues.body:
### Issue Description

if I use RamaLama on the host and it starts a container with `ramalama run ollama://tinyllama:latest` I have

`ai.ramalama.model: ollama://tinyllama:latest`

so I know which model is used if I compare with the value of `ramalama model list` command

but if I use `ramalama serve tinyllama` the value is `ai.ramalama.model: tinyllama`

so it contains the value I provided so it's difficult/impossible to map the container to the original model

I would expect to see `ollama://tinyllama:latest` as well for `ai.ramalama.model`


in container mode, there is an alias being added but the alias is not the fully qualified model name as well
https://github.com/containers/ramalama/pull/1009

### Steps to reproduce the issue

start models using shortnames or a subpart
or use the CLI container

### Describe the results you received

different format of `ai.ramalama.model`

### Describe the results you expected

I expect to always see one of the name returned by `ramalama list`

### ramalama info output

```yaml
0.7.5 / macOS
```

### Upstream Latest Release

Yes

### Additional environment details

_No response_

### Additional information

_No response_
issues.author: benoitf

comments.author: rhatdan
rhatdan
comments.body: We could decorate the shortname our self with TRANSPORT://model:TAG, if we don't see TRANSPORT or TAG specified, but in some cases doesn't ollama translate tiny->tinyllama.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
I guess:

`ramalama model list` == `ramalama list`

playing with docker I guess 😄 

I think `ramalama list/ls` is fine, we don't really do reverse-shortname resolution though (to display the shortname version). Should we? What does podman do here?

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
> [@ericcurtin](https://github.com/ericcurtin) Do you know if there is an easy way to figure out tinylama=ollama://tinyllama:latest?

It wouldn't be that hard to do a reverse lookup if we wanted to.

comments.author: benoitf
comments.body:
The idea behind this is: How to get the model id from 'model list' command when I have a container running 

So no change expected on the list command, but on the annotation/label applied on the container to have as model name the FQN model, the one we can get from 'list' command

It's to be able to

interactive REPL tools like Bash/Zsh/GDB/python don't exit on `^c`, they just give a new clean prompt, while `^d` exits
at first glance, this behavior seems more intuitive to me

issues.title: do not seem to result in usable man pages on a Mac.

comments.body: Also I wonder should we take the opportunity to remove the ":" character from all files names with the migration (illegal character on Windows file systems)

comments.author: engelmi
comments.body:
@ericcurtin What do you mean by doubling model name? The `smollm/smollm` part is due to the structure of `<source>/<organization>/<name>` and if the organization is not given, then it falls back to using the model name as organization. We can easily remove this duplicate.

> Also I wonder should we

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body:
Sounds like it's just an aesthetic change to "ramalama ls" output.

Thanks for the explanations @engelmi . Feel free to ignore my comment about Windows, since this only happens for migrated systems, doesn't matter I guess.

comments.author: ericcurtin
comments.body: FWIW in the actual ollama pulling protocol, when a model has no organization they use "library/". We could have just copied that, it's implementation details. In theory you could have "smollm:135m" and "smollm/smollm:135m" as two different models in the ollama registry, so "library/" is probably mor

issues.title: version from the main branch should have a marker to report 'in development' mode
issues.body:
### Feature request description

when I'm getting the version of RamaLama from the current main branch, today I have `0.7.5`

but this version is not really the one that I'm using, as 0.7.5 is corresponding to a previous tag.

Usually, the version of the development has a suffix to indicate that it's not really attached to a given tag but in the process of development.

If I open/report a bug, instead of reporting `0.7.5` I would report for example `0.8.0-dev` or `0.7.6-next` meaning I'm using a development version

### Suggest potential solution

use a suffix to indicate it's not a fixed version

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
issues.author: benoitf

comments.author: rhatdan
comments.body: We decided against this.

comments.author: benoitf
comments.body:
I think there was a misunderstanding 

It's not to have a separate devel branch and a main branch

just to update the version in the main branch to not be a fixed version but a  -dev suffix

People would still contribute to the main branch.

issues.title: RuntimeError: CUDA version (0, 0) is not supported. Minimum required version is 12.4.
issues.body:
### Issue Description

Depending nvidia-smi version it doesn't include version flag.



### Steps to reproduce the issue

Trigger ramalama

```
$ cat /etc/os-release
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION_ID="22.04"
VERSION="22.04.5 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)"
VERSION_CODENAME=jammy
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
UBUNTU_CODENAME=jammy
```

```
$ ramalama
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/bin/ramalama", line 108, in <module>
    main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/bin/ramalama", line 58, in main
    parser, args = ramalama.init_cli()
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 76, in init_cli
    parser = create_argument_parser(description)
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 112, in create_argument_parser
    configure_arguments(parser)
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 150, in configure_arguments
    default=accel_image(CONFIG, None),
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ramalama/common.py", line 607, in accel_image
    image = select_cuda_image(config)
  File "/home/orion/ramalama/venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/ramalama/common.py", line 574, in select_cuda_image
    raise RuntimeError(f"CUDA version {cuda_version} is not supported. Minimum required version is 12.4.")
```

As we can see below CUDA Version is 12.6, higher than 12.4.
nvidia-smi: 540.4.0

```
$ nvidia-smi
Tue Apr 29 11:53:17 2025
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 540.4.0                Driver Version: 540.4.0      CUDA Version: 12.6     |
|-----------------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU  Name                 Persistence-M | Bus-Id        Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr. ECC |
| Fan  Temp   Perf          Pwr:Usage/Cap |         Memory-Usage | GPU-Util  Compute M. |
|                                         |                      |               MIG M. |
|=========================================+======================+======================|
|   0  Orin (nvgpu)                  N/A  | N/A              N/A |                  N/A |
| N/A   N/A  N/A               N/A /  N/A | Not Supported        |     N/A          N/A |
|                                         |                      |                  N/A |
+-----------------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes:                                                                            |
|  GPU   GI   CI        PID   Type   Process name                            GPU Memory |
|        ID   ID                                                             Usage      |
|=======================================================================================|
|  No running processes found                                                           |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
```

### Describe the results you received

RuntimeError(f"CUDA version {cuda_version} is not supported. Minimum required version is 12.4.")

### Describe the results you expected

No error, doesn't matter which version nvidia-smi is installed (with --version or not so the code is compatible).

### ramalama info output

```yaml
$ ramalama info
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/ramalama", line 108, in <module>
    main(sys.argv[1:])
  File "/usr/local/bin/ramalama", line 58, in main
    parser, args = ramalama.init_cli()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 76, in init_cli
    parser = create_argument_parser(description)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 112, in create_argument_parser
    configure_arguments(parser)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/ramalama/cli.py", line 150, in configure_arguments
    default=accel_image(CONFIG, None),
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/ramalama/common.py", line 607, in accel_image
    image = select_cuda_image(config)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/ramalama/common.py", line 574, in select_cuda_image
    raise RuntimeError(f"CUDA version {cuda_version} is not supported. Minimum required version is 12.4.")
RuntimeError: CUDA version (0, 0) is not supported. Minimum required version is 12.4.
```

Yes

issues.title: get feedback on the pull command when the model already exists
issues.body:
### Feature request description

Today, if I launch for the first time

`ramalama pull tinyllama`

I get a progress bar and I see that something is happening and it's fetching the model.


Now, if I start again the same command, it exits almost immediately and nothing is reported. So while I don't see an error I might thing it worked, but I suppose having a trace like `Model already exists, skipping` or `Model already up-to-date` might give a better outcome of what has being done.

### Suggest potential solution

add a message saying it's already there

### Have you considered any alternatives?

_No response_

_No response_
